views:
To add break point to a particular line:

```
b demo.cpp : 36

```

Manipulatin breakpoint

```
br list // to list all pbreak point

br del # (# can be any numerical value of the breakpoint from list)

br del // to delete all
```

also recall that `b` can jump into class methods and variables.

Steping over

`n`: to move line by line

`s`: to step into a function without breakpoint

`c` to continue running the code normally

**Inspecting variables**

**print variables**

`p varname` e.g `p result`

when you step into a function you move into a new frame.

and you can print the variable in that frame

`fr v`

and to go back to the last selected frame, if the terminal end up verbose.

`frame select`
